summary: The document is a letter from the Department of Justice, Washington, D.C., addressed to Mr. Frank E. Bartos, concerning Miguel Angel Diaz Isalgue, a contract employee involved in national intelligence activities. It details plans for Diaz's travel to Argentina and other South American countries under the alias Juan Hidalgo Elizondo Romano, including the use of a Republic of Nicaragua passport and an Arrival/Departure Record Card (Form I-94). The letter requests the issuance of a Reentry Document (Form I-512) under the alias to facilitate Diaz's return to the United States, accompanied by two photographs of the subject. It also mentions that travel information will be provided prior to departure for control purposes and expresses appreciation for cooperation in this matter.
key_findings: Miguel Angel Diaz Isalgue is a contract employee involved in national intelligence activities.
He is scheduled to travel to Argentina and other South American countries under the alias Juan Hidalgo Elizondo Romano.
The document outlines the use of a Republic of Nicaragua passport and an Arrival/Departure Record Card (Form I-94) for his travel.
A request is made for the issuance of a Reentry Document (Form I-512) under his alias to allow his return to the United States.
The letter indicates that further travel information will be provided and thanks the recipient for their cooperation.
